solution_line_template: First calculate Nancy's monthly portion of the car insurance by multiplying the total cost by 40%: {insurance_percentage_decimal} * ${monthly_total_cost} = $<<{insurance_percentage_decimal}*{monthly_total_cost}={nancys_monthly_portion}>>{nancys_monthly_portion}

Then multiply the monthly cost by {months_per_year} to find the annual cost: ${nancys_monthly_portion} * {months_per_year} = $<<{nancys_monthly_portion}*{months_per_year}={nancys_annual_cost}>>{nancys_annual_cost}
